page.title: 05Homes and houses in Flint
page.content: The old town of Flint is growing, with {new housing estates}being built on the outskirts of the town. Most of the residents are owner occupiers and council house tenants are now having the chance to buy their own homes from the council. The town's{skyline}is dominted by three{high rise blocks}of flats- Richard, Bolingbroke and Castle Heights (the names have links with the town's history). Next to the tower blocks, in the town centre, we have rows of{maisonettes.} Many of the town's{houses}have had home improvements made to them like double glazing and roof and wall insulation. We carried out a{housing} {survey}involving the pupils in our school: 50% have central heating in their homes, 62% are heated by gas, 18% by coal, 18% by electricity, and only 2% by oil.
